titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Portland, Nehalem & Tillamook Railway Company records 1901-1905
Portland, Nehalem & Tillamook Railway Company records

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-05-07.

langusage.language: Finding aid is written in English.

profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS (Describing Archives: A Content Standard), 2nd Edition.

did.unittitle: Portland, Nehalem & Tillamook Railway Company records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Portland, Nehalem & Tillamook Railway Co. (Portland, Or.)

did.abstract: The Portland, Nehalem & Tillamook Railway Company was incorporated February 2, 1901. Collection includes bound manuscript minute book, 1901-1905, and a report, 1901, regarding the progress of the business.

bioghist.p: Per note in the collection: The Portland, Nehalem & Tillamook Railway Company was incorporated February 2, 1901, for the purpose of carrying timber to Portland, Oregon, to "maintain the present lumber supremacy of Portland over all other cities on the North Pacific Coast."

prefercite.p: Portland, Nehalem & Tillamook Railway Company records, Mss 1488, Oregon Historical Society Research Library.

scopecontent.p: Collection includes bound manuscript minute book, 1 volume, 1901-1905, with articles of incorporation and minutes; and a report, 14 pages, 1901, with corrections, of the Portland, Nehalem & Tillamook Railway Company, regarding the progress of the business.

userestrict.p: The Oregon Historical Society owns the materials in the Research Library and makes available reproductions for research, publication, and other uses. The Society does not necessarily hold copyright to all materials in the collections. In some cases, permission for use may require seeking additional authorization from copyright owners.
